title: Orchid & Houseplants Pest Control Made Easy  DIY Garlic-Infused Alcohol Solution #ninjaorchids

tasks.task: Prepare a natural insecticide using garlic to protect orchids from pests.
subtasks: Collect and prepare five cloves of garlic.
Fill a pump spray bottle with 100 milliliters of water.
Add isopropyl alcohol to the solution to make 70% concentration.
Combine garlic pieces with the alcohol solution and let it sit for 24 hours in the fridge.

tasks.task: Create a natural fungicide using garlic.
subtasks: Measure one cup of RO water for the fungicide.
Add quarter cup of ground garlic to the water.
Let the mixture sit and steep for 24 hours in the fridge.

tasks.task: Apply the insecticide and fungicide solutions to the orchids.
subtasks: Ensure the plant is lightly sprayed, focusing on the undersides of leaves.
Repeat the application every three days for the first week, then once a week as needed.
